meanings.definition: A protective covering worn to prevent injury
meanings.sent1: The knight put on his armor before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The police officer's armor shielded him from harm during the riot.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy toddler tried to wear his toy bucket as armor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was her armor against the harsh words of others.
meanings.sent5: The thick armor of the tank gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The turtle's shell acts as its natural armor.
meanings.sent2: The thick walls of the castle served as a strong armor against attacks.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella became my armor against the unexpected rain.
meanings.sent4: His sense of humor was his armor in dealing with difficult situations.
meanings.sent5: The thick fur of the bear provided excellent armor against the cold.

meanings.definition: To equip or cover with armor
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would armor the soldiers before battle.
meanings.sent2: She decided to armor herself with knowledge before the important presentation.
meanings.sent3: The chef would armor the fish with a crispy coating of breadcrumbs.
meanings.sent4: He would armor his heart against further disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The superhero would armor up before facing the villain.
